meanings.sent1: The loud booms of thunder scared the little dog.
meanings.sent2: The boom of the drum signaled the start of the parade.
meanings.sent3: The boom of the fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent4: The boom of the cannon echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The boom of the bass guitar reverberated in the concert hall.

meanings.definition: A period of rapid economic growth.
meanings.sent1: The city experienced a boom in tourism after the new airport opened.
meanings.sent2: The tech industry saw a boom in sales during the holiday season.
meanings.sent3: The sudden boom in real estate prices surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The online business had a boom in customers after their viral marketing campaign.
meanings.sent5: The baby boom in the 1950s led to a surge in school enrollments.

meanings.definition: To make a deep, resonant sound.
meanings.sent1: The fireworks booms could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent2: The thunder booms outside the window woke me up.
meanings.sent3: The old car engine booms loudly when started.
meanings.sent4: The church bell booms across the town every hour.
meanings.sent5: The cannon booms signaled the start of the battle.

meanings.sent1: The construction industry booms in the summer months.
meanings.sent2: The company booms after launching their new product.
meanings.sent3: The flowers in the garden booms with color in the spring.
meanings.sent4: The population of the town booms with new residents.
meanings.sent5: The business booms with the increase in online orders.
